Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two students with a string telephone connecting them.
The student can show that the string is stretched between the two cups each student is holding.
The student can illustrate one student talking into their cup while the other is listening to demonstrate communication over a distance.
The student can draw additional features showing how sound travels through the string (e.g., sound waves or vibrations).
The student can label their drawing to indicate the importance of keeping the string taut for effective sound transmission.
The student can include a note or label explaining that the cups work like speakers to send and receive sound.
The student can provide a caption or label explaining how this simple technology helps people communicate over a distance.
